physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The index patient showed profound metabolic acidosis at day 10 of life. Blood lactate level was 17.1 mmol per liter (normal, <2.1 mmol per liter); lactate:pyruvate ratio was 38 (normal, 12 to 18). Liver dysfunction with direct bilirubin elevation observed from day 7, progressed to full liver failure on day 12.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Liver dysfunction progressed from elevated direct bilirubin at day 7 to full liver failure by day 12, leading to death on day 27.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood lactate level of 9.3 mmol per liter with a lactate:pyruvate ratio of 84.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The male sibling displayed extremely delayed growth and development, with increased muscle tone in upper extremities. Signs of liver failure present at week 7, leading to death at five months of age.
